fields.headline: Greece cracks down on smokers
fields.bodyText: Light up in the wrong place in Greece next year and you could find yourself serving a prison sentence or be landed with a fine. The country with the highest percentage of smokers in the EU is finally cracking down on nicotine addicts. The stiffest penalties of three-month jail terms will be reserved for those taking a puff in a hospital, but smoking is being banned from all inside public areas, including banks, from the end of this year. A spokesman from the Greek Embassy said the ban would start in earnest from January, by which time restaurants must provide special non-smoking areas - though bars and nightclubs will be exempt from the law. · Island hoppers in Greece should avoid travel on 18 June when a proposed public-workers' strike is likely to cause ferry stoppages. A one-day strike at the end of May resulted in dozens of scheduled ferry journeys from Piraeus being scrapped. A spokeswoman from Greek umbrella union ADEDY said the strikes were being staged to protest against the government's proposals for social security reform.
